longDef.en: an occasion or situation that makes it possible to do something that you want to do or have to do, or the possibility of doing something

examples.en: Everyone will have an opportunity to comment.
examples.cn: 每个人都有机会发表意见。

examples.en: I was never given the opportunity of going to college.
examples.cn: 我从没有得到过上大学的机会。

examples.en: The exhibition is a unique opportunity to see her later work.
examples.cn: 这次展览是欣赏她后期作品的难得的机会。

examples.en: An ankle injury meant she missed the opportunity to run in the qualifying heat.
examples.cn: 脚踝受伤意味着她失去了参加资格赛的机会。

examples.en: Please contact us at the earliest opportunity (= as soon as possible).
He goes fishing at every opportunity (= as often as possible).
I used to love going out dancing, but I don't get much opportunity now.
examples.cn: 我过去喜欢去剧院，但现在我没有什么机会去。

examples.en: He had a golden (= an extremely good) opportunity to score in the first half but squandered it.
examples.cn: 他在上半场时有一个绝佳的射门得分机会，可是给浪费掉了。

longDef.en: the chance to get a job

examples.cn: 年轻大学毕业生的就业机会

examples.en: There are some great opportunities now for engineers trained in computer-aided design.
examples.cn: 对受过电脑辅助设计训练的工程师来说，现在有一些很好的就业机会。
